intro: Vepris renieri, commonly known as the Madagascar wild pepper, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The botanical features of Vepris renieri make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
